instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
Hi there, 

Got mba with no liquid damage. Just stopped working. The macchine boots in SMS bypass and working fine but not booting normal way. 

Magsafe led is always greeen. CHecked all main rails and except of <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> are presents. PP5V is pulsing constantly. 


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: I changed <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> thinking it may help but same result. While <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> wasn't on board magsafe turns orange as must.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
"While <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> wasn't on board"
Did you power on the board without <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>???
Check for short on L7520/60 now.

"The macchine boots in SMS bypass"
Some sensor blocks the SMC.
First check <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>.
Next check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.

Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage and check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
"Did you power on the board without <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>???"
No, just plugged magsafe and light turned orange. 

"Check for short on L7520/60 now"

Checked and not shorted. 

<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> 3,3V

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> pulsing 0-1,5V 
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - 0.03-0.06 V pulsing 
<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - pulsing to 0-1,2V
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>. pulsing 0-0.03 every half second. 

PPBUS is 8.62 and constantly goes down 8,5, pulsing too. 

<CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> 

17/18 3.3 
27/28 20 ( it was first i checked.)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
"PPBUS is 8.62 and constantly goes down 8,5, pulsing too."
You didn't mention that before.
If board works with battery, then could be leakage on the input stage.

"No, just plugged magsafe and light turned orange."
3V3/5V MOSFETs got voltage, you've lucky nothing burnt.

"<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - pulsing to 0-1,2V"
1.2V is high enough to block the SMC.
"17/18 3.3"
Did you check directly between <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins?

Try fake charger, or lab power supply with 60/85W cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: Yeah never ever apply power to a board without the TPS or bad things will ensue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
with fake charger doesnt boot . 

"Did you check directly between <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pins?"

Yes. 


With battery connected PPBUS is pulsing 8.42-8.44 battery disconected 8.55-8.62. Doesnt boot with connected battery



"Yeah never ever apply power to a board without the TPS or bad things will ensue..."

Ok John, thanks for info


Any idea what can i do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
Check again <SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.
If still pulses high, change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> now not pulsing its 0.065V and stable. <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> still pulsing 0.03-0.06

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
Must be other SMC sensor involved, if it always starts in SMC bypass.
Can also be SMC, if never gets orange light.
Did you test with correct Magsafe 2 charger?
Post exact voltage for PPBUS/<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: WIthout battery connected PPBUS is 8.54 than 8.58 than 8.60. PPDCIN pulsing too 19,9 to 20,2V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: In SMCBYPASS start ppbus is 8,17V. Is that normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> looks correct, even for SMC bypass.
Try another SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message: Tried new one. Now i have no green light and 8,18 PPBUS. Do you know if 980 YFC LM4FS1BH 5BB... (original that comes with board) can be replaced by 980 YFC LM4FS1AH 5BB ? Also in PDF says LM4FSXAH5BB

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
"Tried new one"
Really new???
Why did you buy that?
SMC has firmware, need to pick it from donor board, same model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> pulsing from 0 to 5.
threads.message:
ok. I changed many times on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and never had problem. Firmware is on 980 YFC/E ?


Will try tomorrow with donor
